O Lord: in thee have I put my trust~; let me not be ashamed

1 ^ Ad te: 3 ^ nèqŭe irrídeant me inimíci mei~; ètenim univèrsi qŭi sùstinent te
Dòmine: non confundèntur. ^ neither let my enemies laugh at me~; for all who wait on thee

1 ^ Ad te: 4 ^ Confundántur òmnes iníqŭa agèntes supervácue. Vias tuas Dòmine demònstra mìhi
Dòmine: et sémitas tuas édoce me. ^ Let all them be confounded that act unjust things without cause. Thy ways

levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: qŭia tu ès Deus salvátor meus
O Lord: et te sustìnui tota die. ^ Direct me in thy truth
column6: for thou art God my Saviour
column7: and on thee have I waited all the day long.

levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: et misericordiárum tuárum qŭaĕ a sáĕculo sunt. ^ Remember thy bowels of compassion
O Lord: O Lord. and thy mercies that are from the beginning of the world.

Dòmine: et ignorántias meas ne memínerîs. Secùndum misericórdiam tuam memènto mei tu
O Lord: Dòmine. ^ The sins of my youth and my ignorances do not remember. According to thy mercy remember thou me

1 ^ Ad te: 8 ^ Dulcis et rectus Dòminus~; pròpter hoc legem dabit delinqŭèntibus in via. ^ The Lord is sweet and righteous~; therefore he will give a law to sinners in the way.
9 ^ Díriget mansuétos in judìcio~; docébit mites vias suas. ^ He will guide the mild in judgment~; he will teach the meek his ways.

levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: reqŭirèntibus testamèntum ejus et testimónia ejus. ^ All the ways of the Lord are mercy and truth
O Lord: to them that seek after his covenant and his testimonies.

levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: propitiáberis peccáto meo~; multum èst ènim. ^ For thy name's sake
thou wilt pardon my sin~; for it is great.

1 ^ Ad te: 12 ^ ¿~Qŭìs èst hòmo qŭi tìmet Dòminum~? Legem statúvit ei in via
Dòmine: qŭam elégit. ^ Who is the man that feareth the Lord~? He hath appointed him a law in the way he hath chosen.
et semen ejus hereditábit terram. ^ His soul shall dwell in good things
levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: and his seed shall inherit the land.

Dòmine: et testamèntum ipsíus ut manifestétur illîs. ^ The Lord is a firmament to them that fear him
levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: and his covenant shall be made manifest to them.

Dòmine: qŭóniam ìpse evèllet de láqŭeo pèdes meos. ^ My eyes are ever towards the Lord
levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: for he shall pluck my feet out of the snare.
qŭia únicus et paŭper sum ego. ^ Look thou upon me
for I am alone and poor.

1 ^ Ad te: 17 ^ Tribulatiónes cordis mei multiplicátaĕ sunt~; de necessitátibus meîs érue me. ^ The troubles of my heart are multiplied~; deliver me from my necessities.
18 ^ Vìde humilitátem meam et labórem meum
Dòmine: et dimìtte univèrsa delìcta mea. ^ See my abjection and my labour

levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: et ódio iníqŭo odérunt me. ^ Consider my enemies
and have hated me with an unjust hatred.

levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: qŭóniam sperávi in te. ^ Keep thou my soul
O Lord: and deliver me~; may I not be ashamed
for I have hoped in thee.

Dòmine: qŭia sustìnui te. ^ The innocent and the upright have adhered to me
levávi ánimam meam. ^ To thee: because I have waited on thee.
Israhélem ex òmnibus tribulatiónibus suîs. ^ Deliver
